Very nicely put game, the gameplay is nice and graphics are satisfying. The puzzles are mentally challenging at times, and the soundtrack kinda makes it seem depressing, but still, It's a good game. And the ending was EPIC! Definitely worth the money!

So portal, so here we are valve. You may not know how to count to three, but we still love your games. Portal was the best puzzle game I played, (still did not play portal 2) and I was enjoying a lot, but there are downsides, the game was relatively short. I only played it for like 5 hours before beating it. Also the final boss, was pitifully easy. Compare it to the rest of the puzzles. Every boss is just a glorified puzzle with an added gimmick in basically every puzzle game known in existance. The puzzle was doing 3 different things with only one thing changed in between. The first time it is hard, but then you know what to do and how to do it if you keep getting farther each time. It becomes really easy and the only problem was with that time limit, let's just say, **** TIME LIMITS!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! But in this game it made some kind of sense why the time limit was implemented, also without the time limit the boss would be extremely easy to beat. Like more laughably easy then it is now. Though this game is fun, screwing around with portals is awesome, the momentum mechanics are so much fun to screw around with trying to finish the level. Although the character roster was lacking. Do not get me wrong the story is awesome, but the amount of characters are 6. 2 if you do not count companion cube or those weird cores on the final boss of the game that for some reason can talk. I guess that adds to the atmosphere of lonliness though. Another thing is that this game is so good it made feel guil and sadness to a cube after incenerating it! A ******* CUBE!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! So this game is really good just wish there was more of it. Oh hello there sequel.

O Portal 1 e 2 , estou enviando a mesma analise, porque um complementa o outro, o Portal 2 é cheio de conteúdo novo e dinâmico, mas fica incompleto sem o Portal 1.

I played through the game, And it's amazing. The puzzles are amazing, But sometimes hard (Not a bad thing), So I had to look up some walkthroughs on certain parts. I loved the creativity and originality put into the gameplay, It really stands out from other puzzle games. I absolutely love the ending as well. Of course, I'm not going to spoil it for you. Just play it for yourself, You'll love it. This is still amazing, Even for a game made in 2007.

When I'm writing this review I just finished the game.

I'm one of those 2000's kids who's supposed to be playing on a PS4 or Xbox but found out about the PC master race. Therefore was my first game in the Portal series Portal 2, which I liked a lot. Last week there the Winter Sale began and I decided to buy $10 worth of games. Eventually I had $2 left and I saw that Portal was in sale too, and seeing Portal gave me memories of how fun Portal 2 was, so I decided to buy it. The game unfortunately doesn't last very long, I finished it in 2 hours, which would give me the possibility to refund it, but I'm not, because the creators deserve their money and I haven't tried the 'Bonus maps' yet. Storywise, the levels started off with a tutorial, some courses where you'd know what to do, and eventually the part where you try to escape and really have to put your skills to the test, I liked the puzzles a lot because you really need to think outside the box and you need to look at thing in different ways. The boss fight is a lot like a normal course but there's a different objective. After defeating the final boss, I saw a cutscene and the credits afterwards. I managed to watch all the credits because the songs in both games are amazing!

Pro's:
- Great story
- Good controls
- Great music
- It teaches you to think in possibilities, not limits
- It teaches you to think outside the box
- It teaches you to look at things in different ways
- Boss fights are nice
- Great fun overall

Con's:
- It doesn't last long (2 hrs in my case)

Overall:
The experience is definately worth $10, but it won't last very long. (Except for Portal 2, because there's a Workshop for it)

以前玩的盗版1跟2全通关了，现在趁着特价入个正版  极度好评  无论是创意 关卡设计 剧情 还是音乐  都令人享受 谜题难度适中而且循序渐进 让人很容易体验到解谜的快感 随着游戏进程的推进 光圈科技计划的逐渐显露跟旁白透露出的信息 也让人很有玩下去的欲望综合1跟2 GLaDOS的角色塑造也很棒  两部作品的歌都超级好听！总之强烈推荐

Portal es uno de esos juegos, esos que recuerdas cada cierto tiempo y te entran una irremediables ganas de jugar.
Portal es un juego atemporal que toda persona con ordenador deberia jugar. Un juego sobre la tenacidad, sobre buscar la solución al problema siempre, aunque te digan que ese problema es imposible o aunque te vayan a quemar vivo. Portal no busca hacerte sentir apabullado por sus puzzles; quiere te acomodes, que te sientas bien cada vez que abres la puerta final de cada sala, como si fueras el ser humano más inteligente del mundo por cruzarla. 
Puede que tenga una corta duración, pero merece ser disfrutado. Porque cuando lleges a los creditos y empiece a sonar ESA canción, dará igual que sea tu primera o novena vez en completarlo, sabrás que Portal es uno de esos juegos.

great

It's a very quick game - I got through the main game in about three hours total, and beyond that there's just challenges revisiting a few of the test chambers.

But it's also a good game. The puzzling is not too complicated (all you can do is shoot the portal gun, move around, and move objects around) but still gets tricky without being impossible. The portals are also a fun mechanic that I still wasn't tired of using properly by the end of the game. The plot could be better - exposition is never great, and a lot is left unexplained at the end (including what happens to you). But the main point is obvious and drives the endgame forward. Graphics and sound do not detract from the experience, even if they don't contribute much either.

It's also a fairly humorous game, and has a nice song at the end, so there's that.

In short: I think its small size makes it worth less than most other titles, but it's definitely worth two bucks during a sale. Left me looking forward to Portal 2.

To keep it short. If you expect a shooter, then you probably have the wrong expecation what this game is about. It's not a shooter at all. It's a physics & puzzle game, which makes it unique. Despite its age (over 9 years) it's still  one of the best games in my opinion, due to its unique playstyle & interesting concepts. 

If you are into solving problems & physic games (which were already implemented in the Half Life series), then just go for it! You won't regret it. Many people will probably consider this to be a 'must-played' game, along with other games as the already mentioned Half-Life series and other classic games.

On a sidenote: The game is rather short (Although that is relative). I've beaten it in a few hours, so you might want to get it while it's on sale. It usually is on discount for 75% which is a lot. Many people don't want to spend relatively much money for such an old game, but it's 100% worth it when it's on sale.

I love this game. It was the first I bought on steam and it is amazing. The closed in feel you get is unique to this game, and I loved every second of it. You get the feeling you anen't just being watched by GLADoS, but also by scientists. The game does have flaws though. The game is a bit short (only 19 test chambers) but does have extra modes (least step, portal and time challenges) and a harder difficulty. But I still love this game. I would give it a 8,5/10
